Summary Technical Marketing Engineer - Cisco Systems - Enterprise Backbone Group - Mar 2012 - present 
I manage and evangelize the technical aspects, marketing activities and collateral of Catalyst 4500 switches, including whitepapers, technical slide decks, proof-of-concept hardware labs and reports, feature enhancements, SW and HW engineering commit requirements and recommendations, trade show demos and technical presentations, and answering constant questions from multiple email aliases from SEs and account teams. Specialize in 4500 VSS (Virtual Switching System), and testing, documenting and demonstrating the latest SW features. 
 
Technical Support Engineer - Brocade Communications - IP Switching and Routing 2011-2012 
I resolved cases involving enterprise and service provider customers using Brocade (former Foundry product line). Cases involved L1 connectivity, L2 connectivity and configuration, and L3 routing including OSPF, BGP, PIM-SM, MPLS, LDP, and Multi-chassis configurations on MLX and CER,  
 
Senior Engineer - Product Launch Support - Tellabs. 
Supporting service providers / carriers in telecommunications using Tellabs 8800, 8600 WAN router product lines. Main features: high-density WAN / MAN / LAN router: MPLS, VRF, VPLS, VPWS; pseudowires, martini circuits; BGP, ISIS, OSPF, SONET / SDH, EoS, MLPPP, T1 IMA, SIAD; QoS; traffic policing, shaping; T1 - DS1 / DS3 - OC3 MUX, SIAD device configuration and testing. 
 
Specialties: Carrier / service provider core network router NPI and applications test engineer. Areas of expertise: 
MPLS, VRF, VPLS, VPWS, BGP, OSPF, ISIS, MLPPP, EoS, IMA. Product demos, features testing and usage guidelines, lab setup: design and lab testing; customer facility reproductions; documenting new features test cases. Interop testing with multiple vendors - Nortel, Cisco, Charles Industries, Telco Systems, Tellabs 5500NGX, Ericsson. Experience Technical Marketing Engineer, Enterprise Backone BU Cisco Systems March 2012  – Present (3 years 6 months) San Jose, CA I teach people about the benefits of Cisco Catalyst switching technologies and product features. 
I help Sales teams, Cisco partners and resellers market and close sales on Catalyst 6500 and 4500X L2/L3 Ethernet switching and routing products. I extol virtues and evangelize Catalyst existing and upcoming HW and SW technologies, differentiating features, and product roadmaps. I perform testing and verification for customers, partners, SEs, Cisco engineering teams, TAC personnel, and product marketing teams - on general and specific capabilities, specifications, compliance, interoperability, bug reproductions, research and escalations, and product and feature usability.  
I author product deployment best-practices guides, white papers, design guides, “At-a Glance,” “FAQs,” TDM decks, and various customer and partner-facing technical-marketing-focused product documentation, including internal- and external-facing presentation slide decks and tutorials.  
I design and build lab test beds, trade show demos, and customer proof-of-concept labs to test, demonstrate, and document solutions, features, capabilities, capacity and performance, and a multitude of existing Catalyst switching features, like all IPv4, IPv6 routing protocols, VRF, MPLS, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, IS-IS and PIM, and newer Cisco specific features like IP SLAs, Mediatrace, Secure Group Tags, Flexible Netflow collection and analysis, embedded event manager, and Ethernet port-based link encryption. I build and write demo scripts and formally present product and feature portfolios, roadmaps and features demonstrations at various internal, customer, partner, public-forum and Cisco-sponsored events throughout the US and around the world. I also constantly research and answer a never-ending stream of technical and product-specific questions from our SEs and account teams.
